item.title: Le Travenues Technology Ltd Hits Intraday Low Amid Price Pressure
item.description: Le Travenues Technology Ltd experienced a significant intraday decline on 13 Feb 2026, touching a low of Rs 197.1 as the stock faced notable price pressure, underperforming its sector and broader market indices amid subdued market sentiment. Time: 6 minutes ago

item.title: Hexaware Technologies Ltd Hits Intraday High with 5.38% Surge on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: Hexaware Technologies Ltd demonstrated a robust intraday performance on 13 Feb 2026, surging to an intraday high of Rs 562.75, marking a 3.46% rise from its previous close. The stock reversed a seven-day losing streak, outperforming its sector and broader market indices despite opening lower. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Dec-2025 Quarterly Earnings Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has unfolded with a nuanced picture, as 3,041 companies declared results reflecting a modest improvement in positive outcomes compared to recent quarters. While mid-cap firms led with a 53.0% beat ratio, large caps lagged at 42.0%, underscoring sectoral and size-based disparities in corporate performance. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: KPIT Technologies Sees Sharp Open Interest Surge Amid Price Weakness
item.description: KPIT Technologies Ltd has witnessed a significant 13.2% increase in open interest in its derivatives segment, signalling heightened market activity despite the stock’s recent downward price trajectory. This surge in open interest, coupled with rising volumes and deteriorating price momentum, suggests a complex interplay of investor positioning and potential directional bets in the software consulting sector. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Prestige Estates Sees Sharp Open Interest Surge Amidst Weak Price Action
item.description: Prestige Estates Projects Ltd (PRESTIGE) has witnessed a notable surge in open interest in its derivatives segment, rising by nearly 15% to 18,141 contracts, signalling increased market activity despite the stock’s recent underperformance. This spike in open interest, coupled with elevated volumes and shifting price dynamics, suggests evolving market positioning and potential directional bets among investors in the realty sector. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: IL&FS Engineering & Construction Co Ltd Plunges to Lower Circuit Amid Heavy Selling Pressure
item.description: Shares of IL&FS Engineering & Construction Co Ltd plunged to their lower circuit limit on 13 Feb 2026, reflecting intense selling pressure and panic among investors. The stock closed at ₹26.06, marking a maximum daily loss of 4.99%, significantly underperforming its sector and the broader market indices. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Eastern Silk Industries Ltd Plunges to Lower Circuit Amid Heavy Selling Pressure
item.description: Eastern Silk Industries Ltd witnessed intense selling pressure on 13 Feb 2026, hitting its lower circuit limit of 5% and closing at ₹63.18, marking a maximum daily loss of 4.99%. The stock’s sharp decline reflects mounting investor concerns amid persistent negative momentum and unfilled supply, signalling a challenging outlook for this micro-cap textile company. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Physicswallah Ltd Sees Exceptional Volume Surge Amid Volatile Trading
item.description: Physicswallah Ltd (PWL), a mid-cap player in the Other Consumer Services sector, witnessed extraordinary trading volumes on 13 Feb 2026, signalling a notable shift in investor sentiment. The stock surged 6.62% intraday, reversing a six-day losing streak, while trading volumes soared to over 2.7 crore shares, reflecting heightened market activity and volatility. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Surge in Open Interest Signals Bullish Momentum for Torrent Pharmaceuticals Ltd.
item.description: Torrent Pharmaceuticals Ltd. has witnessed a notable surge in open interest in its derivatives segment, reflecting heightened market participation and a potential directional shift. The stock’s recent price action, combined with increased volumes and improved market positioning, suggests growing investor confidence amid a broader sector outperformance. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Motisons Jewellers Sees Exceptional Volume Surge Amid Positive Momentum
item.description: Motisons Jewellers Ltd, a key player in the Gems, Jewellery and Watches sector, has witnessed a remarkable surge in trading volume, signalling renewed investor interest and positive momentum. The stock outperformed its sector and broader market indices, supported by strong volume and price action, marking a notable turnaround from its previous sell rating. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Faze Three Ltd Surges to Upper Circuit on Robust Buying Momentum
item.description: Faze Three Ltd, a micro-cap player in the Garments & Apparels sector, witnessed a remarkable rally on 13 Feb 2026, hitting its upper circuit limit with a maximum daily gain of 9.57%. The stock closed at ₹604.60, surging ₹48.15 from the previous close, driven by strong buying interest and significant unfilled demand amid a regulatory freeze on further transactions. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Small-Cap Segment Sees Broad Weakness Amid Select Bright Spots on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: The BSE Smallcap index declined by 0.63% on 13 Feb 2026, reflecting a challenging environment for smaller companies as broader market pressures persist. Despite the overall downturn, select stocks within the segment delivered notable gains, underscoring a divergence in performance across the small-cap universe. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Sensex Dips Nearly 1% Amid Broad-Based Sector Declines; Metals Lead Losses
item.description: The Indian equity market witnessed a broad-based sell-off on 13 Feb 2026, with the Sensex closing nearly 1% lower at 82,865.16, retreating 809.76 points from the previous close. Market breadth was heavily skewed towards declines, reflecting cautious investor sentiment amid weak global cues and sectoral pressures. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Mid-Cap Segment Sees Broad Weakness Amid Selective Stock Gains on 13 Feb 2026
item.description: The BSE Midcap index declined by 0.61% on 13 Feb 2026, reflecting widespread selling pressure across the segment. Despite the overall weakness, a handful of stocks demonstrated resilience, with Hexaware Technologies leading gains at 5.38%, while Muthoot Finance lagged with a steep 11.52% loss. Market breadth was notably weak, with only 18 stocks advancing against 125 decliners, resulting in a subdued advance-decline ratio of 0.14x. Time: 23 minutes ago

item.title: Large-Cap Segment Faces Downward Pressure Amid Defensive and Cyclical Divergence
item.description: The large-cap segment, represented by the BSE 100 index, has experienced a notable decline over recent sessions, reflecting a cautious market mood. Despite the overall downturn, select heavyweight stocks and defensive sectors have shown resilience, while cyclical names have faced pressure, underscoring the prevailing market dichotomy. Time: 23 minutes ago
